title: U.S. Moves to Appease Allies on EV Subsidies
description: The number of North American-built vehicles eligible for tax credits will increase significantly after Jan. 1—and EVs assembled overseas could qualify for subsidies if purchased for lease.

title: FCC Set to Gain More Power Over Prison Phone Call Rates
description: The federal regulator will have more power to tackle what it has called excessive charges for inmates making in-state phone and video calls.

title: Apple Production in China Ramps Up Despite Covid Woes
description: Covid-19 issues in China are still hampering manufacturing of Apple’s iPhone, but production is beginning to catch up to demand for the more-expensive Pro models.

title: Cathie Wood and Elon Musk Are Almost Right About Fed
description: The two are correct in that higher rates are dragging down tech, but that is hardly the whole story.

title: Europe Taps Tech's Power-Hungry Data Centers to Heat Homes
description: With an energy crisis hitting Europe, governments are exploring ways to recycle electricity used on social-media scrolling, conference calls and video streaming to help heat homes and offices.

title: Consumers Change Food-Delivery Habits
description: Consumers continue to spend more on DoorDash and Uber Eats, but growth is slowing and people are spending more cautiously.

title: Technology Puts American Chestnut Trees on the Comeback Trail
description: The U.S. is considering whether to release a genetically modified version tolerant of blight, as some people warn of environmental risks.

title: Some Twitter Users Experience Technical Problems With Platform
description: Social-media app owned by Elon Musk suffers glitches, with some users getting error messages.
